channel.title: How can I prevent this from happening again?
channel.description:
Some guy some how got my password on my owners account on my server how can they do that and how can I prevent from this ever happening again? ~Quote~ why do the hackers have to ruin the fun?
~horror~ :| :| :| :confused: :confused:

item.title: How can I prevent this from happening again?
item.dc:creator: @d_man103456 d man103456
item.description:
@d_man103456 wrote:

download it, open it, click generate, there is your pass. Honestly if you make your account only accesable via localhost your account will be impossible to hack even if they do get your pass

item.title: How can I prevent this from happening again?
item.dc:creator: @d_man103456 d man103456
item.description:
@d_man103456 wrote:

Yeah thats pretty much your only way to prevent it and, you might want to and an

playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("username1 || username2")

(may not be in correct format)to your ban commands and add your username and ur staffs usernames. It simple means that when someone does the ban command it ignores all usernames in that case.

For example this is my ipban command

[code] if (command.startsWith(“ipban”) && playerRights > 1 && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“totalpk || raped”)) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(6);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		p.writeLog(p.playerLastConnect, "ipbans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have ipbanned "+p.playerName+"!");
                    yell("["+playerName+"] has just IP banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ip ban..");
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How can I prevent this from happening again?

item.title: How can I prevent this from happening again?
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

  1. Use a password generator for your passwords.

  2. Only allow your account to be accessed from the IP ‘127.0.0.1’

That way if the person isnt connected to YOUR computer, it wont let them login.

(if you’re using a VPS, change 127.0.0.1, to your ip)

Read full topic
